{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Coordinator, Grants and Contract",
  "description": "eHealth Africa designs and implements data-driven solutions and technologies to improve health systems for and with local communities. eHA&rsquo;s technology works in low connectivity settings and uses data to drive decision-making by local governments and partner agencies to get optimum results.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Coordinator, Grants and Contract

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Program Delivery

Purpose of the position&nbsp;


	The Grants &amp; Contracts unit at eHealth Africa ensures robust compliance and delivery mechanisms across the full lifecycle of donor-funded projects and internal grantmaking.
	It provides policy interpretation, sub-award oversight, and tools that uphold accountability, strategic alignment, and program impact. The unit supports all departments with contractual clarity, performance tracking, and regulatory assurance in a dynamic operating environment.
	The Coordinator, Grants &amp; Contracts, plays a key role in supporting the financial and compliance management of donor-funded programs.
	The role assists in pre- and post-award processes, including grant tracking, compliance monitoring, documentation, and coordination between internal teams and external partners. It ensures that grant agreements are managed according to organizational procedures and donor regulations, contributing to the smooth delivery of projects.


What You&rsquo;ll Do&nbsp;
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other duties may be assigned:


	Coordinate the review and processing of grant and contract agreements, ensuring alignment with donor and organizational guidelines.
	Track grant deliverables, timelines, and reporting requirements, maintaining accurate records in the grant management system.
	Assist in the preparation of grant budgets, budget modifications, and financial documentation in collaboration with finance teams.
	Maintain a centralized filing system for all grant and contract documentation in line with audit and donor standards.
	Support project teams in ensuring timely submission of narrative and financial reports and preparation of donor financial reports.
	Liaise with program, procurement, and finance teams to ensure grant activities are aligned and properly documented.
	Monitor sub-award agreements to ensure proper reporting and compliance by implementing partners.
	Assist in compiling documentation for audits and donor compliance reviews.
	Contribute to donor communications by preparing drafts of correspondence, updates, and report summaries as required.
	Update and improve templates, tracking tools, and workflows related to grants and contracts.
	Adheres to Policies and Procedures.
	Adheres to the eHealth Africa Code of Conduct as well as ethical standards of the field.


Who You Are
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform this job successfully.


	Grants Strategist:&nbsp;Skilled at navigating donor regulations and aligning them with internal processes to streamline grants management.
	Compliance Leader:&nbsp;Diligent in maintaining contract integrity, financial accountability, and audit preparedness.


Analytical and Detail-Oriented:&nbsp;Adept at reviewing budgets, agreements, and performance data for accuracy and risk.


	Clear Communicator:&nbsp;Confident in presenting grant-related findings, requirements, and guidance to both internal and external stakeholders.
	Proactive Coordinator:&nbsp;Capable of leading processes independently while engaging stakeholders to ensure efficient execution.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in grant or contract support roles, preferably within an NGO or donor-funded environment.

Coordinator, Grants and Contract Job at eHealth Africa




        
    

        
        eHealth Africa designs and implements data-driven solutions and technologies to improve health systems for and with local communities. eHA’s technology works in low connectivity settings and uses data to drive decision-making by local governments and partner agencies to get optimum results.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Coordinator, Grants and Contract

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Program Delivery

Purpose of the position 
     

            
    




	The Grants & Contracts unit at eHealth Africa ensures robust compliance and delivery mechanisms across the full lifecycle of donor-funded projects and internal grantmaking.
	It provides policy interpretation, sub-award oversight, and tools that uphold accountability, strategic alignment, and program impact. The unit supports all departments with contractual clarity, performance tracking, and regulatory assurance in a dynamic operating environment.
	The Coordinator, Grants & Contracts, plays a key role in supporting the financial and compliance management of donor-funded programs.
	The role assists in pre- and post-award processes, including grant tracking, compliance monitoring, documentation, and coordination between internal teams and external partners. It ensures that grant agreements are managed according to organizational procedures and donor regulations, contributing to the smooth delivery of projects.


What You’ll Do 
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Other duties may be assigned:


	Coordinate the review and processing of grant and contract agreements, ensuring alignment with donor and organizational guidelines.
	Track grant deliverables, timelines, and reporting requirements, maintaining accurate records in the grant management system.
	Assist in the preparation of grant budgets, budget modifications, and financial documentation in collaboration with finance teams.
	Maintain a centralized filing system for all grant and contract documentation in line with audit and donor standards.
	Support project teams in ensuring timely submission of narrative and financial reports and preparation of donor financial reports.
	Liaise with program, procurement, and finance teams to ensure grant activities are aligned and properly documented.
	Monitor sub-award agreements to ensure proper reporting and compliance by implementing partners.
	Assist in compiling documentation for audits and donor compliance reviews.
	Contribute to donor communications by preparing drafts of correspondence, updates, and report summaries as required.
	Update and improve templates, tracking tools, and workflows related to grants and contracts.
	Adheres to Policies and Procedures.
	Adheres to the eHealth Africa Code of Conduct as well as ethical standards of the field.


Who You Are
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform this job successfully.


	Grants Strategist: Skilled at navigating donor regulations and aligning them with internal processes to streamline grants management.
	Compliance Leader: Diligent in maintaining contract integrity, financial accountability, and audit preparedness.


Analytical and Detail-Oriented: Adept at reviewing budgets, agreements, and performance data for accuracy and risk.


	Clear Communicator: Confident in presenting grant-related findings, requirements, and guidance to both internal and external stakeholders.
	Proactive Coordinator: Capable of leading processes independently while engaging stakeholders to ensure efficient execution.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in grant or contract support roles, preferably within an NGO or donor-funded environment.
	Familiarity with donor regulations (e.g., Gates Foundation EU, DFID) is an advantage.
	Experience with software such as NetSuite, Google Workspace, Asana, etc.
	Strong understanding of donor budget requirements and cost proposal development.


Certifications and Licenses:


	Financial, Accounting,  Project Management, or the equivalent are desired.

Business Developer Job at Lifemate Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Lifemate Nigeria Limited is a professional furniture multinational corporation with 22 outlets distributed across Lagos, Abuja, Port Harcourt, Ibadan, Ogun and with core competencies in different types of furniture, like kitchen cabinets, wardrobes, bedroom furniture, hotel furniture, office furniture, dining set, light fittings, jacuzzi, steam box, shower cubicles, outdoor rattan products, interior decoration and so on.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Developer

Job Locations: Ikeja - Lagos, Wuse 11 - Abuja (FCT) and Mowe - Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Identifying, qualifying, and securing business opportunities; coordinating business generation activities; developing customized targeted sales strategies
	Building business relationships with current and potential clients

	Collaborating with sales and leadership to secure, retain, and grow accounts
	Creating informative presentations; presenting and delivering information to potential clients at client meetings, industry exhibits, trade shows, and conferences
	Creating and maintaining a list/database of prospective clients; maintaining a database of prospective client information
	Cold calling; making multiple outbound calls to potential clients; closing sales and working with the client through the closing process
